oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1943-04-17 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 17, 1943. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach, Zeke Clements, Minnie Pearl, Pap's Jug Band, and Mac McGar. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Recording begins with the end of the previous Opry segment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rachel Veach; Zeke Clements; Minnie Pearl
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Closing theme -- Announcer closing statement -- Station announcement -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Opening theme -- Louie Buck introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys with Rachel Veach -- Good Old Mountain Dew (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Rachel Veach) -- George D. Hay introduces Zeke Clements -- Smoke On The Water (Zeke Clements) -- George D. Hay introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- In The Shadow Of The Pines (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- The Precious Jewel (Roy Acuff)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Pap's Jug Band; Wilson, Lonnie; Minnie Pearl; McGar, Mac; Clements, Zeke
